intro: Blakea hirsutissima var. hirsutissima, commonly known as the hairy blakea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. It typically grows as an epiphyte on trees in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important component of its native forest ecosystems.
